Challenge.definition: to dispute esp. as being invalid or unjust [counsel challenged this interpretation] 2

1.definition: a calling into questiona questioning of validity or legality[when the to the statute is in effect a of this basic assumption ", 395 U.S. 621 (1969)"] see also

2.definition: a request to disqualify a trier of fact (as a jury member or judge) compare,

challenge for cause.definition: a challenge esp. of a prospective juror based on a specific and stated cause or reason

challenge to the array.definition: a challenge of an entire jury that raises objections to the selection process

peremptory challenge.definition: a challenge esp. of a prospective juror that does not require a stated cause or reason
